alert.note: Alert for Wheatland (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 10 at 8:12PM MDT until April 12 at 11:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: .Snow melt from the base of the Little Snowies and Crazy Mountains has resulted in minor flooding across portions of western Wheatland County. Additional snow melt due to very warm temperatures through Tuesday will likely push water levels on small creeks and streams even higher. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Montana, including the following county, Wheatland. * WHEN...Until 330 PM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of small creeks and streams, low-lying areas, and culverts. Rural roads and bridges may be washed out or damaged. Livestock may become stranded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 804 PM MDT, Local county officials have reported flooding along Lebo Creek south of Two Dot, and Haymaker Creek north of Two Dot. A few rural roads have been washed out in spots. Culverts are overflowing in some areas. - Reports indicate flooding is mainly in the Two Dot and Martinsdale vicinities, but the Harlowton area could see small creeks flooding as well. Water levels may continue to rise for another day or two due to very warm temperatures melting additional snow in the foothills. Residents should prepare for even higher water levels. A pattern change at midweek will bring this round of significant snow melt to an end. - Some locations that will experience minor flooding include...Two Dot and Martinsdale, and possibly Harlowton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Remain alert for flooding of creeks, streams, and culverts. Move livestock to higher areas or safe locations so they do not become stranded.
